body: Can you update the doc (https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/docs/security/shiroauthentication.md#ldap) as well, so user reading http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.7.0/security/shiroauthentication.html#ldap can leverage this feature.

Thanks for your effort @zjffdu. Looks good. Probably it's nit; but it'll be better to keep consistency for `Zeppelin` and `zeppelin` | `Pig` and  `pig`. Can we make all `zeppelin` and `pig` to `Zeppelin` and `Pig`?
I see this is merged in branch-0.7 should we close this ?
On retrying CI is green now. https://travis-ci.org/prabhjyotsingh/zeppelin/builds/204880085
On retrying the same build, CI is green now https://travis-ci.org/prabhjyotsingh/zeppelin/builds/204865706
Merge into branch-0.7 and master if there are no more comments on this.

@dlukyanov Is this WIP or ready for review? If it's WIP, then could you update the title to sth like "[WIP][ZEPPELIN-2196] Groovy interpreter"? It'll be helpful to other reviewers to recognize this PR's status. You can remove `WIP` whenever you think it's done :)

And I think the other interpreter's PR can be helpful to you (e.g. A PR for BigQuery Interpreter: #1170 ). Especially [this comment](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/1170#issuecomment-232215164) :)
On re-triggering CI is green now. https://travis-ci.org/prabhjyotsingh/zeppelin/builds/204868665.

Hello, can somebody help me to understand jenkins failure

> + python ./travis_check.py dlukyanov 46d3ea6
> [2017-02-26 10:29:08] Author: dlukyanov, commit: 46d3ea6
> [2017-02-26 10:29:08] --------------------------------
> [2017-02-26 10:29:13] Get build status ...
> [2017-02-26 10:29:13] Can't find build for commit= 46d3ea6
> Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
> Putting comment on the pull request
> Finished: FAILURE
@prabhjyotsingh FYI, you can change the red light to the green by closing and reopening this PR :)
AFAIK, it was removed before because someone blame log4j.properties location. Do you know the history? Personally, I agree that it includes conf.
created a new pull request [#2068](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/2068)
Sure, let me check. I wasn't aware.
I think you are right. I'll close this, and use `ZEPPELIN_INTP_CLASSPATH_OVERRIDES` and use a different path where ever it is really required.
Thank you @felixcheung  and @jongyoul  for the quick feedback.

## Newly added commits

- Remove `local` values in helium package jsons: https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/1982/commits/ce5f8c0c0f88de79bd9c4172a5d74066c9345a50
- DON't refresh `helium.json` when fetching spell config to reduce execution time: https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/1982/commits/dbc4f10fd3ee556d5e38cb4f6e3966661eaf69a9

I have basically only set up zeppelin in isolated mode with impersonation, so I'm not sure what is the "expected" behavior is outside of that. Someone else will have to pitch in here.
@Leemoonsoo @zjffdu @felixcheung @karuppayya  Could you guys help to review about the impersonation mode?

CI failed, but irrelevant.

- build profile: https://travis-ci.org/1ambda/zeppelin/builds/206002571
- failed log1: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/206002573/log.txt
- failed log2: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/206002574/log.txt

Even in the impersonation mode, it is the process owner to interrupt the process. Here it is the interpreter process owner interrupt the process instead of the zeppelin server owner.  But I can not verify it in impersonation mode. It seems the impersonation mode is broken. I got the following error, can anyone else verify the impersonation mode ?

```
ERROR [2017-02-28 09:20:18,882] ({pool-2-thread-2} Job.java[run]:194) - Job failed
org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterException: org.apache.hadoop.security.authorize.AuthorizationException: User: user1 is not allowed to impersonate user1
```

@zjffdu I tested impersonation mode followed http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.7.0/manual/userimpersonation.html and worked well.
BTW for now anybody can interrupt to interpreter process. and that is @FireArrow's worrying. Am i right?

> User zeppelin have permission to execute paswordless sudo to local users allowed to log into Zeppelin
> Interpreters will with this run as the user starting the process, and the zeppelin user will not have permission to send any signal to them.

I think @FireArrow 's concern is that zeppelin user can kill the process. Actually it is not the user zeppelin send the signal, it is the interpreter process owner. So I don't think there's any permission issue here. @FireArrow Please help confirm.

Thanks @oeegee Looks good to me. 
Merge into branch-0.7 and master if there are no comments on this.
